metadata.documentation: Remove poly-A tails from nucleotide sequences
metadata.relations: EDAM_topic:0747 Nucleic acid sites and features
EDAM_operation:0363 Nucleic acid sequence reverse and complement

parameter.name: minlength
parameter.information: Minimum length of a poly-A tail
parameter.help: This is the minimum length that a poly-A (or poly-T) tail must have before it is removed. If there are mismatches in the tail than there must be at least this length of poly-A tail before the mismatch for the mismatch to be considered part of the tail.

parameter.name: mismatches
parameter.information: Number of contiguous mismatches allowed in a tail
parameter.help: If there are this number or fewer contiguous non-A bases in a poly-A tail then, if there are '-minlength' 'A' bases before them, they will be considered part of the tail and removed . \ For example the terminal 4 A's of GCAGAAAA would be removed with the default values of -minlength=4 and -mismatches=1 (There are not at least 4 A's before the last 'G' and so only the A's after it are considered to be part of the tail). The terminal 9 bases of GCAAAAGAAAA would be removed; There are at least -minlength A's preceeding the last 'G', so it is part of the tail.

parameter.name: reverse
parameter.information: Write the reverse complement when poly-T is removed
parameter.help: When a poly-T region at the 5' end of the sequence is found and removed, it is likely that the sequence is in the reverse sense. This option will change the sequence to the forward sense when it is written out. If this option is not set, then the sense will not be changed.

parameter.name: tolower
parameter.help: The poly-A region can be 'masked' by converting the sequence characters to lower-case. Some non-EMBOSS programs e.g. fasta can interpret this as a masked region. The sequence is unchanged apart from the case change. You might like to ensure that the whole sequence is in upper-case before masking the specified regions to lower-case by using the '-supper' sequence qualifier.

parameter.name: fiveprime
parameter.information: Remove poly-T tails at the 5' end of the sequence.
parameter.help: If this is set true, then the 5' end of the sequence is inspected for poly-T tails. These will be removed if they are longer than any 3' poly-A tails. If this is false, then the 5' end is ignored.
